Characterization of lecithin—cholestero! acyltransferase from human plasma. 3.
‘Chemical properties of the enzyme

KUI SONG CHONG, MeHRNOOSH JAHANI, SHINICHI HARA, AND ANDRAS G. Lack
Department of Chemistry, Division of Biochemistry, North Texas State University, Denton, TX, U-S.A. 76203
cand
Department of Biochemistry, Texas Collegeof Osteopathic Medicine, Denton, TX, U.S.A. 76203
Received November 1, 1982

‘Chong, K.S.,Jahani, M,, Hara, , & Lacko, A. . (1983) Characterization of ecithin-cholesterol acyltransferase from buman
‘plasma, 3. Chemical properties ofthe eazyme. Can. J. Biochem. Cel Biol. 61, 875-881

‘The polypeptide molecular weight of lecthincholeserl acyltransferase (LAT) (45.000) was obtsined by deducting the
‘weight of carbohydrate moiety 25%, wiw) from the total molecular weight of 60000. LCAT was found to have a relatively high
‘Content of glutamic acid, aspartic acd, glycine, and leucine residues and fourhalf-cystines. The carbohydrate content was found
tobe about 25% (w/w): hexoses, 13% bexosamines, 6.2%; and sialic acid, 5.4%. The total number of 408 amino acid residues
per mole and the mean residue weight of 110,3 were found. From Nuorescence spectroscopy analysis, 6~7 mol of tryptophan
‘Were found per mole of LCAT in 10mM phosphate (pH 7.4). However, when LCAT was digested by the mixture of
‘chymotrypsin and pronase the tryptophan residues increased to 10-11 molimol of LCAT, which agrees well with dato obtained
previously by ultraviolet absorption spectoscopy. A paral speciic volume of 0.707 mig was determined by compositional
Snalysis. Human LCAT was found to have a relatively high extinction coeficient (Ey) of 21 at 280 nm and neutral pH. Two
{sides of eysteine per mole of LCAT were estimated both in the presence or absence of sodium dodecyl sulfate by tiation with
5.5 -dithiobis-2-nitrobenzoic acid. The enzyme showed a lower tendency fo staining with Coomassie blue R-250 than bov
Serum albumin, The enzyme was rapidly inactivated by disopropy! fuorophosphate (DFP), regardless of whether the free
sulfiydryl were blocked or aot. The enzyme was also reversibly inhibited by cysteine above concentrations of mM. Neither
the high density tipoprotein nor liposome substrate was able to protect against te inhibition by cysteine or DEP.

 

(Chong, K.S.,Jahani, M., Hara, S, & Lacko, A. G. (1983) Characterization of leithin~cholesteal acyltransferase from human,
plasma. 3. Chemical properties ofthe enzyane. Can. J. Biochem. Cell Biol. 61, 875-881
[Nous obtenons le poids moléculaire du polypeptide de la Iseithine—cholestérol acytransférase (LCAT) (45000) par
soustaction du poids del fraction glucidique (25%, pip) du poids moléculaire total de 600000, La CAT contient une quantté
felativerentclevée de résius d'aide glutamique, d'acide aspatique, de glycine et de leucine et quatre demi-cystins. Lateneur
hicidgue est d'environ 25% (pip) hexoses, 13%; hexosamines, 6,2%% acide silique, 5.4%, Le nombre total des résidus
asides amings est de 408 par mole et le poids moyen d'un ésidu est de 110,3, D'aprés analyse par spectroscopic de
fluorescence, 6-7 mol de tryptophane sont présentes par ole de LCAT dans le phosphate 10 m8 (pH 7,4). Cepeadant quand
LLCAT est digéeé par un mélange de chymotrypsine et de pronase les résidus de tryptophane augmentent 3 10-11 moVmol de
LLCAT. ce qui s'aeorde bien avec les données obtenves atérieurement pa spectroscope d'absorptionultaviolete. Par analyse
de lacomposition, nous avons determing un volume spécfique patel de 0,707 mL, La LCAT humaine posséde un coefficient
extinction (£1) reativement élevé de 21 2280 nm etun pH neue. Nous avons évalué tes deux résidus de cystéine par mole
{de LCAT en présence ou en absence de dodge sulfate de sodium par titration avec I'acide 5,5"-dthiobis-2-nivobenzoique. La
teadance de I'enzyme A se colorer avec le bleu de Coomassie R-250 est moindre que celle de I'albumine sérique bovine
[Lienzyie est rapidement inactvée par le disopropyl fuorophosphate (DFP), que les groupes sulfhydyes libres sofent blogués
‘ounot. A des concentrations dépassant ma, lacystéine inhibe I'enzyme d>fagon reversible. Nils lipoproines de densi
<levée ales liposomes ne sont capables de protéger enzyme contre inhibition par In eytéine ou le DEP.
[Traduit par fa revue]

 

LCAT is the enzyme mainly responsible for produc-
ing cholesteryl esters in human plasma (1). The enzyme
has been assigned to have a key role in lipoprotein
‘metabotism (2), but little is known yet of its structure,
function, and mechanisms of action. Although several

‘AneREViATiONS: LCAT, leithin-cholesterol acylransfer-
ase; E, extinction coeficient, DEP, diisopropyl fuorophos-
phate; DTNB, 5,5°-dithiobis-2-nitrobenzoic acid; SDS, so-
{ium dodecyl sulfate; BSA, bovine serum albumin; V, partial
specie volume; HDL, high deasity lipoprotein: PC, phospha-
‘idyleboline; apo, apoprotein.

investigators have reported on the amino acid compos
tion and substrate specificity of the enzyme employing
‘mainly liposome substrates, the role of specific amino
acid residues in the catalytic action of the enzyme bas
not yet been established.

‘The paucity of definitive information in this area has
been mainly due to the lack of procedures that consis-
tently yield sufficient amount of enzyme for detailed
ccharacierization studies and to the labile nature of the
‘enzymatic activity in highly purified preparations. We
have recently developed a highly reproducible method
that allowed the isolation of milligram quantities of

summary: The polypeptide molecular weight of lecthincholeserl acyltransferase (LAT) (45.000) was obtsined by deducting the carbohydrate moiety 25%, wiw) from the total molecularweight of 60000. LCAT was found to have a relatively high. content of glutamic acid, aspartic acd, glycine, and leucine residues and fourhalf-cystines. The enzyme was rapidly inactivated by disopropy! fuorophosphate (DFP) and reversibly inhibited by cysteine above concentrations of mM.
